fields.description:
Our current API for Ti.Buffer makes use of a {{byte[]}}. While https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/11810 helps us to copy those bytes out to an {{ArrayBuffer}} on the JS side (though Ti.Blob), we should consider retooling {{Ti.Buffer}} to use a {{ByteBuffer}} with direct allocation pointing to the same exact memory shared by the JS engine's {{ArrayBuffer}}.

This blog post makes reference to how the J2V8 project did exactly this: https://eclipsesource.com/blogs/2016/07/25/typedarrays-sharing-memory-between-v8-and-java/

Essentially this would involve Ti.Buffer wrapping a {{ByteBuffer}} rather than a {{byte[]}}. We could then read/write to the bytes from the native or JS side **without** crossing the JNI/V8 native bridge.
